Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.reactors

Non-blocking, Isolation, Thread-bound and Swing-bound Reactors

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Reactor
    The Reactor interface identifies the processing methods that can be used by applications.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Inbox
    Provides at least two queues for a targetReactor's incoming messages, where the first queue is a concurrent linked queue for messages passed from other reactors and the other(s) are doLocal queues for messages that are passed using the targetReactor's own thread.
    IsolationInbox
    The inbox used by IsolationReactor, the next request is not made available for processing until a result is assigned to the previous request.
    IsolationReactor
    A targetReactor which processes each request to completion, and which should be used by blades which perform long computations, I/O, or otherwise block the thread.
    NonBlockingInbox
    The inbox used by NonBlockingReactor, ThreadBoundReactor and SwingBoundReactor, NonBlockingInbox uses a single ArrayDeque for the doLocal queue.
    NonBlockingReactor
    A targetReactor for blades which process messages quickly and without blocking the thread.
    Outbox
    An outbox holds a collection of doSend buffers.
    ReactorBase
    Base class for targetReactor.
    SwingBoundReactor
    Messages are processed on Swing's event-dispatch thread when an blade uses a SwingBoundReactor.
    ThreadBoundReactor
    A targetReactor bound to a pre-existing thread, a thread-bound targetReactor can use a program's main thread or a GUI thread.
    UnboundReactor
    Common code for NonBlockingReactor and IsolationReactor, which are not bound to a thread.

Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.reactors Description

Non-blocking, Isolation, Thread-bound and Swing-bound Reactors

While MessageProcessors are used by the Event and AsyncRequest classes to pass and process messages, the Reactor interface itself include only a few methods for use by application developers.

Creating a Reactor

Blades can use 4 different classes of reactors: NonBlockingReactor, IsolationReactor, ThreadBoundReactor and SwingBoundReactor. Reactor instances are easily created, with an instance of Facility as a required parameter. Additional parameters can be also be passed to the constructor for configuring a targetReactor:

  • int initialBufferSize This is the initial size of the the doSend buffers used by the outbox. When not provided, Facility.getInitialBufferSize() is used instead.
  • int initialLocalQueueSize The initial size of the doLocal queue(s) used by the inbox. When not provided, Facility.getInitialLocalMessageQueueSize() is used instead.
  • Runnable onIdle The onIdle.run method is called when the inbox becomes empty. (This parameter does not apply to ThreadBoundReactor nor to SwingBoundReactor.)
  • Runnable boundProcessor The boundProcessor.run method is called when a thread-bound processor has messages that need processing. As a result of invoking the boundProcessor.run method, the ThreadBoundReactor.run method be invoked in turn by the thread that the processing is bound to. (This parameter applies only to ThreadBoundReactor.)
